intro: Platystele dressleri, commonly known as the Dressler's flat-leaved orchid, is a rare and endangered species native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and intricate floral structure. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Platystele dressleri is known for its unique sympodial growth habit, with short, creeping rhizomes and compact, rosette-like foliage. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
